intro: Anacampseros telephioides, commonly known as the sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to dry environments. The plant has fleshy, ribbed leaves that store water, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
